Methods

<static> bind(bindListener)

Binds to the Dynamix Framework.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
bindListener function The web client should provide a listener which would listen to changes in the bind state.
Example
var bindListener = function(status) {
            switch(status) {
                case Dynamix.Enums.BOUND :
                    openDynamixSession();
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.BIND_ERROR :
                    Dynamix.bind(bindListener)
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.UNBOUND :
                    break;
            }
        }
        Dynamix.bind(bindListener);

<static> closeDynamixSession(optParams)

Close the current dynamix session. NOTE : This'll also remove any context support that was added by the web client. The client will have to open a new session before making any further requests to Dynamix. The client will still be bound to Dynamix.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
optParams Object The web client can provide an optional callback which'll be provided the success or failure state of the request.

<static> createContextHandler()

Creates a new context handler.
Example
var createNewHandlerCallback = function(status, handler) {
            switch(status) {
                case Dynamix.Enums.SUCCESS :
                dynamixContextHandler = handler;
                break;
            }
        };
        Dynamix.createContextHandler(createNewHandlerCallback);

<static> getAllContextPluginInformation() → {Object}

Get information about all the context plugins.
Returns:
Object which contains the result.
Type
Object
Example
Dynamix.getAllContextPluginInformation();

<static> getAllContextPluginsForType(contextType) → {Object}

Get information about all the context plugins of the given type.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
contextType String The context type for which the context plugins information should be fetched.
Returns:
Object which contains the result.
Type
Object
Example
Dynamix.getAllContextPluginsForType('org.ambientdynamix.contextplugins.batterylevel');

<static> getContextPluginInformation(pluginId)

Get information about a particular plugin.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
pluginId String The plugin id for which the information should be fetched.
Example
Dynamix.getContextPluginInformation('org.ambientdynamix.contextplugins.batterylevel');

<static> getDynamixVersion()

Retrieve the version of the Ambient Dynamix Framework.

<static> getInstalledContextPlugins() → {Object}

Get information about all the currently installed context plugins.
Returns:
Object which contains the result.
Type
Object
Example
Dynamix.getInstalledContextPlugins();

<static> isDynamixActive()

Returns true if Dynamix is active; false otherwise. NOTE : The Dynamix Framework becomes inactive when the device screen turns off and active again when the screen is turned on.

<static> isSessionOpen()

Returns true if the web client's session is open; false otherwise.
Example
Dynamix.isSessionOpen();

<static> openDynamixSession(optParams)

Open a new Dynamix Session. A session can be opened only after the bind call was successful.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
optParams Object Optional callback and listener
Example
var openSessionCallback = function(status) {
            switch(status) {
                case Dynamix.Enums.SUCCESS :
                    createContextHandler();
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.FAILURE : 
                    break;
            }
        };          
        //The session listener gets updates when
        //1. Session state changes.
        //2. Plugin state changes.
        var sessionListener = function(status, result) {
            switch(status) {
                case Dynamix.Enums.SESSION_OPENED :
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.SESSION_CLOSED : 
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.PLUGIN_UNINSTALLED :
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.PLUGIN_INSTALLED :
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.PLUGIN_ENABLED :
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.PLUGIN_DISABLED :
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.PLUGIN_ERROR :
                    break;
                case Dynamix.Enums.DYNAMIX_FRAMEWORK_ACTIVE:
                	break;
            	case DYNAMIX_FRAMEWORK_INACTIVE:
            		break;
            }
        };
        Dynamix.openDynamixSession({listener:sessionListener, callback:openSessionCallback});

<static> removeContextHandler(handler, optParams)

Remove a context handler. NOTE : This'll also remove any context support that was added to the context handler and the web client will have to request a new handler to make any further context support requests.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
handler Object The handler object which should be removed.
optParams Object The web client can provide an optional callback which'll be provided the success or failure state of the request.

<static> setDynamixSessionListener(listener)

Set a listener for session changes.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
listener function
Example
Dynamix.setDynamixSessionListener(listener);

<static> unbind()

Unbind dynamix. This'll completely clear all communication with the Dynamix Framework. The web client will need to call bind() and start fresh.
